abstract.p: Dennis Publishing begins offering stock picks in Maxim men's magazine (S)

block.p: Yet another unlikely publication has jumped on the stock-picking bandwagon -- Maxim, Dennis Publishing's hot-selling journal of beer and babes.
The cover of the September issue has the obligatory photo of a scantily clad starlet (this time, the teenage actress Kirsten Dunst) and promises of ''More Sex!'' ''More Sports!'' ''More Girls!''
Yet another unlikely publication has jumped on the stock-picking bandwagon -- Maxim, Dennis Publishing's hot-selling journal of beer and babes.
The cover of the September issue has the obligatory photo of a scantily clad starlet (this time, the teenage actress Kirsten Dunst) and promises of ''More Sex!'' ''More Sports!'' ''More Girls!''
But next to Ms. Dunst's elbow are the words ''the Maxim mutual fund.'' Hmmm. Inside, the editors have compiled a 16-stock model portfolio that aims to ''put the fun back in mutual fund.''
(Of course, no such fund actually exists for readers to invest in. Maxim is merely fantasizing about one -- it is, after all, a men's magazine.)

The Maxim picks include Daxor, which runs one of the nation's largest sperm banks; La-Z-Boy, the easy-chair maker; and, inevitably, Anheuser-Busch. ''When economy sinks lower than Vanilla Ice, consumers will still scrounge beer money,'' Maxim explained.
Memo to Smart Money, Kiplinger's, Forbes et al.: You might want to rethink next month's cover.
